result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hillard F Szlapka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:20 P.M., Defendant Hillard F Szlapka in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel and Court find defendant competent per Dr. Smith's findings, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 16 CM 256, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 in 16 CM 256 dismissed, 16 CM 148, 16 CM 149 and 16 CM 182, dismissed, read in, 16 CM 256, Ct. 1, Court sentences defendant to: 10 days jail, 8 days sentence credit, sentence is time served, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 2:31 P.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Competency Report filed by Dr. Brad Smith - by fax
ok to remove return date, and order for evaluation.
from Atty Eagon re: defendant's competency
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Genda
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Genda

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  No acts or threats of violence towards M.S.  Standad misd. conditions.

Defendant Hillard F Szlapka by video, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $500.00 signature bond.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  No violent or abusive contact towards M.S.  Standard misd. conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:40 pm.  Return date scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
